headline: Almost Everything Is Rallying Ahead of Fed Decision. What’s Not Matters More.
summary: The closest it got was on July 11, 2024 when the index fell 0.9% and 396 stocks gained, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  On that day, it was Tesla, Lam Research, Nvidia, Applied Materials, and Micron that dragged on the index.  This time around Broadcom, Palantir Technologies, and Nvidia were the among the big laggards, but Microsoft, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, Tesla, and Amazon.com were also dragging on the index.

headline: This Tech Stock Just Hit Another All-Time High
summary: Lam Research (LRCX) is a leading semiconductor equipment supplier, showing strong technical momentum and consistent price appreciation. LRCX maintains a 100% “Buy” rating from Barchart. Shares have gained 58% over the past year. Fundamentals remain robust with projected revenue and earnings growth, a wide economic moat, and strong analyst and...

headline: ASYS' Cost Reduction Initiatives: Can it Drive Margin Expansion?
summary: Amtech Systems' $13M savings and semi-fabless shift drove Q3 margin gains, with more cost cuts set to fuel profitability.

headline: 3 Reasons We Love Lam Research (LRCX)
summary: The past six months have been a windfall for Lam Research’s shareholders. The company’s stock price has jumped 54%, setting a new 52-week high of $120.61 per share. This was partly thanks to its solid quarterly results, and the performance may have investors wondering how to approach the situation.
